title: [K-12] Mathematical Analysis Competency Development Project for Pre-Service Elementary Teachers: Integrated Application in Social Studies Curriculum Contexts

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics concepts (proportionality, algebra) and foundational pedagogy understanding, basic knowledge of elementary social studies curriculum (integrated society/culture/history), and awareness of multicultural educational environments
context.additional_context: Team activities and weekly feedback sessions using smartphone-based collaboration tools. Case studies converting community issues (e.g., population distribution, resource allocation) into mathematical problems, emphasizing application in real-life contexts. Focus on cultivating core social studies competencies (citizenship, critical thinking).

learning_goals: Achieving the ability to solve mathematical problems (proportionality/algebra) using at least two different methods and analyzing alignment with social studies curriculum standards

Accurately identifying and explaining over 80% of mathematical knowledge elements applied to problem-solving, and proposing methods to integrate them into elementary social studies-mathematics combined lessons
Creatively generating at least three variations of a given problem, evaluating educational validity, and assessing applicability in multicultural classroom environments

Evaluating and integrating peersâ€™ problem-solving strategies in team-based discussions, and cultivating social skills (communication, conflict management) for designing collaborative learning environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
